trans-unit.source: Harnessing the power of community creates a natural and truly next-generation VPN experience. Choose from a network of VPN providers with flexible, pay-as-you-go pricing so it’s easy to find service that works for you. Access the open internet from restricted zones, harden your security with multiple hops and choose where you want your traffic to exit. All open-source, secure and without any middlemen.
trans-unit.target: Harnessing the power of community creates a natural and truly next-generation VPN experience. Choose from a network of VPN providers with flexible, pay-as-you-go pricing so it’s easy to find service that works for you. Access the open internet from restricted zones, harden your security with multiple hops and choose where you want your traffic to exit. All open-source, secure and without any middlemen.

trans-unit.source: Multi-hop routing connects multiple relays and adds security at each step.
trans-unit.target: Multi-hop routing connects multiple relays and adds security at each step.

trans-unit.source: Connect out of restricted zones. Works with existing VPN providers that are blocked.
trans-unit.target: Connect out of restricted zones. Works with existing VPN providers that are blocked.

trans-unit.source: No middleman or monthly contracts. Pay peer-to-peer, just for what you use.
trans-unit.target: No middleman or monthly contracts. Pay peer-to-peer, just for what you use.
Orchid가 디지털 개인 정보를 보호하는 방법

trans-unit.source: The Orchid network enables a decentralized virtual private network (VPN), allowing users to buy bandwidth from a global pool of service providers.
trans-unit.target: Orchid 네트워크는 분산 VPN(가상 사설망)을 활성화하여 사용자가 서비스 제공 업체의 글로벌 풀에서 대역폭을 구매할 수 있도록 허용합니다.

trans-unit.source: To do this, Orchid uses an ERC-20 utility token called OXT, a new VPN protocol for token-incentivized bandwidth proxying, and smart-contracts with algorithmic advertising and payment functions. Orchid's users connect to bandwidth sellers using a provider directory, and they pay using probabilistic nanopayments so Ethereum transaction fees on packets are acceptably low.
trans-unit.target: 이를 실시하려면 Orchid는 토큰 인센티브 대역폭 프록시를 위해 OXT라고 부르는 새로운 VPN 프로토콜, ERC-20 유틸리티 토큰과 알고리즘 광고 및 결제 기능을 갖춘 스마트 컨트랙트를 사용합니다. Orchid 사용자는 제공 업체 디렉토리를 사용하여 대역폭 판매자와 연결하고 확률적 나노페이먼트를 사용하여 지불하므로 패킷의 이더리움 거래 수수료는 상당히 낮습니다.

trans-unit.source: Users of Orchid run a client similar to a typical VPN client for protocols such as OpenVPN, but which speaks the Orchid protocol. The Orchid network client goes past the basic functionality offered by most VPN clients, with features such as the ability to run traffic through an integrated personal firewall. The Orchid client is accessible via iOS, Android, macOS, Linux, and (soon) Windows.
trans-unit.target: Orchid 사용자는 OpenVPN과 같은 프로토콜이지만 Orchid 프로토콜이라 일컫는 일반적인 VPN 클라이언트와 비슷한 클라이언트를 실행합니다. Orchid 네트워크 클라이언트는 통합된 개인 방화벽을 통해 트래픽을 실행할 수 있는 기능과 함께 대부분의 VPN 클라이언트가 제공하는 기본 기능을 능가합니다. Orchid 클라이언트는 iOS, Android, macOS, Linux 및 Windows(곧 출시 예정)를 통해 액세스할 수 있습니다.

trans-unit.source: Get the pre-release version of the app today!
trans-unit.target: 지금 사전 출시 버전의 앱을 받으십시오!

trans-unit.source:
OXT’s primary and fundamental purpose is to keep track of who has used computing services, who has provided computing services, and whether the average user is fairly compensating the average provider.
The OXT token provides value in the Orchid network in a number of ways:
A Bandwidth Provider - Anyone can operate an Orchid Node, but must first stake OXT, with the more OXT that is staked, the greater the chances of reward in the Network.
A Bandwidth User- For the first time, users can pay-on-the-fly for a private, secure internet connection. To power up the client, a user installs the Orchid VPN, adds OXT to a wallet, and then can access the internet through a user-chosen path to ensure a secure connection anywhere in the world. Users only pay for the bandwidth they consume.
The bandwidth marketplace is peer-to-peer and run in a completely decentralized manner without reliance on any central party. The primary reasons for a native token are:
To have a token that is specifically tied to consumption of bandwidth on the Orchid network
To align operator incentives towards the benefit of the Orchid Network.
Accordingly, in addition to facilitating bandwidth transactions on the Network, the Orchid Token is used to prove a stake within the Orchid network that is intended to demonstrate a commitment for bandwidth providers, as well as to mitigate certain risks.
trans-unit.target:
OXT의 주된 기본 목적은 누가 컴퓨팅 서비스를 사용하는지, 누가 컴퓨팅 서비스를 제공하는지, 그리고 평균 사용자가 평균 공급 업체에게 공정히 보상하는지 여부를 계속해서 추적하는 데 있습니다.
따라서, OXT 토큰은 여러 가지 방법으로 Orchid 네트워크에 가치를 제공합니다.
대역폭 제공 업체 - 누구든지 Orchid 노드를 운영할 수 있지만, 스테이크할 OXT가 많을수록 네트워크에서 보상을 받을 가능성이 더 높아지므로 먼저 OXT를 스테이크해야 합니다.
대역폭 사용자 - 처음으로, 사용자는 안전한 개인 인터넷 연결에 대해 순식간에 지불할 수 있습니다. 클라이언트의 전원을 켜려면, 사용자가 Orchid VPN을 설치하고 지갑에 OXT를 추가한 다음, 사용자가 선택한 경로를 통해 인터넷에 액세스하여 전 세계 어디에서나 안전하게 연결할 수 있습니다. 사용자는 그들이 소비한 대역폭에 대해서만 비용을 지불합니다.
대역폭 마켓플레이스는 피어 투 피어이며 중심 주체에 의존하지 않고 완전히 분산된 방식으로 운영됩니다. 네이티브 토큰에 대한 주요 이유는 다음과 같습니다.
Orchid 네트워크에서 대역폭 소비와 특별히 관련 있는 토큰을 보유하기 위해.
Orchid 네트워크의 혜택에 대한 운영자 인센티브를 조정하기 위해.
따라서, 네트워크에서 대역폭 거래를 용이하게 하는 것 외에도, Orchid 토큰은 대역폭 제공 업체에 대한 약속을 입증할 뿐 아니라 특정 위험을 완화하기 위해 고안된 Orchid 네트워크 내의 스테이크를 증명하는 데 사용됩니다.

trans-unit.source: The Orchid software is designed to use a custom VPN protocol, similar in scope to OpenVPN or WireGuard. The Orchid protocol is designed for high-performance networking and runs on top of WebRTC, a common web standard, widely used to transmit video and audio from inside browsers. Our protocol is intended to allow users to request access to remote network resources and pay for these resources using OXT via a nanopayments system.
trans-unit.target: Orchid 소프트웨어는 OpenVPN 또는 WireGuard와 범위가 유사한 사용자 지정 VPN 프로토콜을 사용합니다. Orchid 프로토콜은 고성능 네트워킹을 위해 설계되었으며, 일반 웹 표준인 WebRTC의 상위에서 실행되고 브라우저 내부에서 비디오 및 오디오를 전송하는 데 널리 사용됩니다. Orchid 프로토콜을 사용하면 사용자가 원격 네트워크 리소스에 대한 액세스를 요청하고 나노 지불 시스템을 통해 OXT를 사용하여 이러한 리소스에 대한 요금을 지불할 수 있습니다.

trans-unit.source:
Orchid uses a new probabilistic nanopayment system to scale payment throughput.
This nanopayment system is the foundation of the Orchid peer to peer bandwidth marketplace where clients pay Node operators OXT “tickets” for proxy bandwidth. The system is designed to lower the transaction fees on small payments by amortizing transaction fees across many transactions and even across multiple parties.
For more information, see our recent article: Introducing Nanopayments
trans-unit.target:
Orchid는 새로운 확률적 나노 지불 시스템을 사용하여 지불 처리량을 확장합니다.
이 나노 지불 시스템은 클라이언트가 노드 운영자에게 프록시 대역폭에 대한 OXT "티켓"을 지불하는 Orchid P2P 대역폭 시장의 기반입니다. 이 시스템은 많은 거래와 심지어 여러 주체에 걸쳐 거래 수수료를 분할 상환함으로써 소액 결제 시 거래 수수료를 낮추도록 설계되었습니다.
자세한 내용은 다음의 최근 기사를 참조하십시오. 나노 지불 소개

trans-unit.source:
Service providers on Orchid run software similar to a typical VPN daemon for protocols such as OpenVPN, but which speaks the Orchid protocol.
Orchid nodes maintain registration information in a stake registry and provider directory on Ethereum. The stake registry is optimized for enabling the Orchid app to automatically discover random servers in a decentralized environment, while the provider directory allows Orchid nodes to register metadata such as geolocation or additional services offered.
trans-unit.target:
Orchid 서비스 공급자는 OpenVPN과 같은 프로토콜이지만 Orchid 프로토콜이라 일컫는 일반적인 VPN 데몬과 비슷한 소프트웨어를 실행합니다.
Orchid 노드는 이더리움의 지분 레지스트리 및 제공자 디렉토리에 등록 정보를 유지합니다. 지분 레지스트리는 Orchid 앱이 분산 환경에서 임의의 서버를 자동으로 검색할 수 있도록 최적화되어 있으며, 제공자 디렉토리는 Orchid 노드가 지리적 위치 또는 제공되는 추가 서비스와 같은 메타데이터를 등록할 수 있도록 허용합니다.

trans-unit.source:
A provider stakes some number of OXT tokens to create a stake deposit.
Anyone can stake OXT on nodes using the smart contract.
Clients select new nodes in proportion to their relative OXT deposit size.
Larger stake deposits thus lead to proportionally more users, bandwidth, and revenue.
If the node is already at max bandwidth capacity additional stake is effectively wasted.
Once tokens have been locked into a stake deposit they can be used immediately for bandwidth provisioning. If the provider wants to withdraw tokens from the staking contract, they have to start an ‘unlocking’ process period, which involves a three month cooldown where their funds cannot be used as a stake deposit or transferred elsewhere by the provider.
Whatever the amount of value that is exchanged in the Orchid ecosystem, a given seller’s relative stake amount, as a percentage of the total stake, provides them that same percentage of user traffic and dealflow. Assuming typical and honest selling behavior (no users drop them for bad service) this dealflow will translate into a similar portion of the total revenue. The staking decisions of sellers is left to their own choices.
trans-unit.target:
제공 업체는 스테이크 예치금을 생성하기 위해 일부 OXT 토큰을 스테이크합니다.
스마트 컨트랙트를 사용하여 누구든지 노드에서 OXT를 스테이크할 수 있습니다.
클라이언트는 상대적인 OXT 예치금 크기에 비례하여 새로운 노드를 선택합니다.
따라서, 비례적으로 더 큰 스테이크 예치금은 더 많은 사용자, 대역폭 및 수익으로 이어집니다.
해당 노드가 이미 최대 대역폭 용량에 있으면 추가 스테이크가 효과적으로 낭비됩니다.
일단 토큰이 스테이크 예치금에 고정되면, 이는 즉시 대역폭 프로비저닝을 위해 사용될 수 있습니다. 공급 업체가 스테이킹 컨트랙트에서 토큰을 인출하고자 할 경우, '잠금 해제' 프로세스 기간을 시작해야 합니다. 이 기간에는 3개월의 쿨다운이 포함되어 있어 해당 공급 업체 자금을 스테이크 예치금으로써 사용하거나 제공 업체에 의해 다른 곳으로 이체할 수 없습니다.
Orchid 에코시스템에서 교환되는 가치의 금액이 무엇이든, 총 스테이크의 백분율로써 주어진 판매자의 상대 스테이크 금액은 동일한 비율의 사용자 트래픽 및 거래 흐름을 제공합니다. 일반적이고 정직한 판매 행위(그 어떤 사용자도 불량한 서비스를 제공하지 않음)를 가정한다면 이 거래 흐름은 총 수익의 비슷한 부분으로 해석됩니다. 판매자의 스테이킹 결정은 자신의 선택에 달려 있습니다.

trans-unit.source:
Tap the link below on your iOS device.
https://www.orchid.com/ios-pre-release
Follow the instruction to install TestFlight.
Install Orchid.
trans-unit.target:
iOS 기기에서 아래 링크를 누릅니다.
https://www.orchid.com/ios-pre-release
지침에 따라 TestFlight를 설치하십시오.
Orchid를 설치하십시오.

trans-unit.source:
Tap the link below on your Android device.
https://www.orchid.com/android-pre-release
Accept the terms for early access.
Install Orchid using the link displayed.
trans-unit.target:
Android 기기에서 아래 링크를 누릅니다.
https://www.orchid.com/android-pre-release
얼리 액세스 약관에 동의합니다.
표시된 링크를 사용하여 Orchid를 설치하십시오.

trans-unit.source: Read the whitepaper to learn about our next-level VPN.
trans-unit.target: Orchid가 개발 중인 소프트웨어를 알아보려면 이 백서를 읽어보십시오.

trans-unit.source: We believe that by eliminating centralization, rewarding network contributors, and harnessing the power of blockchain, we can offer users better privacy.
trans-unit.target: Orchid는 중앙 집중화를 제거하고 네트워크 기여자에게 보상을 제공하며 블록 체인의 이점을 활용함으로써 사용자에게 더 나은 개인 정보 보호를 제공할 수 있다고 생각합니다.

trans-unit.source: Ethereum allows Orchid to operate without a central authority, and the network is completely permissionless.
trans-unit.target: 이더리움 덕분에 Orchid는 중앙의 권위에 의지하지 않고도 거래를 수행할 수 있게 되었습니다. 앱은 서버를 통해서가 아니라 기기 상에서 로컬로 실행되며 데이터가 저장되지 않습니다.

trans-unit.source: Orchid software is Open Source to enable the sharing of ideas, auditing and debugging by the community, and of course, contributions.
trans-unit.target: Orchid 소프트웨어는 커뮤니티는 물론 기여자들이 아이디어를 공유하고 감사 및 디버깅을 수행할 수 있게 해주는 오픈 소스 기술입니다.

trans-unit.source: Clients and network providers transact directly with no middlemen, creating a low-cost marketplace for bandwidth and VPN connectivity.
trans-unit.target: 클라이언트와 네트워크 공급자는 중개자 없이 직접 거래하여 대역폭 및 VPN 연결을 위한 저비용 시장을 형성합니다.

trans-unit.source: In a world where one assumes the Cambridge Analytica scandal is merely the tip of the iceberg when it comes to data abuse, it’s easy to see the project’s appeal."
trans-unit.target: 투입된 비용과 사명, 설립자의 요구를 모두 고려하여 소프트웨어를 개발하는 것은 중요한 일입니다. 계속 지켜봐 주십시오."

trans-unit.source: Orchid’s mission is to build open-source software that keeps the Internet open and accessible — a natural resource for everyone, everywhere.”
trans-unit.target: Orchid의 사명은 모든 사람이 어디서나 이용할 수 있는 천연 자원이 될 수 있도록 인터넷을 개방적이고 액세스 가능한 상태로 유지하는 오픈 소스 소프트웨어를 개발하는 것입니다."

trans-unit.source: Orchid is developing an open-source decentralized and surveillance-free internet protocol intending to provide anonymized internet access to the global community.”
trans-unit.target: Orchid는 전 세계 커뮤니티에 익명의 인터넷 액세스를 제공하기 위해 감시가 필요 없는 오픈 소스 방식의 분산형 인터넷 프로토콜을 개발 중입니다."

trans-unit.source: Get the newsletter for updates and privacy news
trans-unit.target: 업데이트 및 개인 정보 보호 뉴스에 대한 뉴스 레터 받기

trans-unit.target: How can the Orchid app help me with privacy today?

trans-unit.target: How is Orchid private given that it has public payments on Ethereum?

trans-unit.target: Can Orchid nodes monitor network traffic?

trans-unit.target: So I'm totally private and anonymous when I use a VPN like Orchid?

trans-unit.target: How does the Orchid token (OXT) work?

trans-unit.target: How do curated lists work on Orchid?

trans-unit.source: Orchid is a decentralized, market-based system for anonymous communication and virtual private networking, including a bandwidth market where node providers stake tokens to advertise their services using the Ethereum blockchain and receive payment in OXT (Orchid’s native cryptocurrency).
trans-unit.target: Orchid is a decentralized, market-based system for anonymous communication and virtual private networking, including a bandwidth market where node providers stake tokens to advertise their services using the Ethereum blockchain and receive payment in OXT (Orchid’s native cryptocurrency)

trans-unit.source: Orchid’s mission is to build Open Source software that keeps the internet open and accessible — a natural resource for everyone, everywhere.
trans-unit.target: Orchid’s mission is to build Open Source software that keeps the internet open and accessible — a natural resource for everyone, everywhere.

trans-unit.source: The Orchid network enables a decentralized virtual private network (VPN), allowing users to buy bandwidth from a global pool of service providers.
trans-unit.target: In the Orchid marketplace, incentives are used to create economic security and reliability between clients and servers in a permissionless way. This peer-to-peer marketplace is dynamic; clients can select single- or multi-hop onion routed circuits by selecting nodes randomly weighted on stake and filtered on secondary desiderata (price, location, etc.). A single hop route has the benefits of a normal VPN connection, creating a tunnel to route your traffic over a public network or your ISP, while a multi-hop connection provides additional privacy benefits by securing your network data from any one provider.

trans-unit.source: If you are a casual reader, a normal VPN user, or just exploring crypto applications, you can learn the basics about what Orchid is good for right now, and how to safely use it to get more online privacy than you had before.
trans-unit.target: If you are a casual reader, a normal VPN user, or just exploring crypto applications, you can learn the basics about what Orchid is good for right now, and how to safely use it to get more online privacy than you had before.

trans-unit.source: If you are an open source security researcher, this works as an introduction to a system that exists (not vaporware) that uses financial incentives to reward the growth of the network and has numerous computational and networking primitives that really serious networking security might eventually be built out of. Orchid Labs welcomes your interest.
trans-unit.target: If you are an open source security researcher, this works as an introduction to a system that exists (not vaporware) that uses financial incentives to reward the growth of the network and has numerous computational and networking primitives that really serious networking security might eventually be built out of. Orchid Labs welcomes your interest.

trans-unit.source: Basic Internet connections function by transmitting packets of data between two hosts (computers). In order to find their way, packets contain both a source and destination IP address. As packets move from the destination to the source, different routers and physical infrastructure require both of these addresses for the two-way connection to be established and maintained. This means that instantly and over time, the owners of the physical infrastructure are in a position to build a profile of Internet usage on their paying user (you!) and also to block content as the owner sees fit.
trans-unit.target: Basic Internet connections function by transmitting packets of data between two hosts (computers). In order to find their way, packets contain both a source and destination IP address. As packets move from the destination to the source, different routers and physical infrastructure require both of these addresses for the two-way connection to be established and maintained. This means that instantly and over time, the owners of the physical infrastructure are in a position to build a profile of Internet usage on their paying user (you!) and also to block content as the owner sees fit.

trans-unit.source: Typically these infrastructure owners are ISPs — mobile carriers providing phone data connections, home cable Internet providers, WiFi hotspot operators, and any Internet backbone operators that have peering agreements with user-facing ISPs. In all these cases, the ISP is in an advantaged position to monitor and/or restrict Internet usage. It is common in many countries for ISPs to restrict content so that users cannot load certain websites.
trans-unit.target: Typically these infrastructure owners are ISPs — mobile carriers providing phone data connections, home cable Internet providers, WiFi hotspot operators, and any Internet backbone operators that have peering agreements with user-facing ISPs. In all these cases, the ISP is in an advantaged position to monitor and/or restrict Internet usage. It is common in many countries for ISPs to restrict content so that users cannot load certain websites.

trans-unit.source: If you are not happy with or do not trust your existing ISP(s), by using Orchid you can currently limit their knowledge to knowing only that you are sending and receiving bytes through Orchid, and completely block their ability to mess with the details of your traffic, unblocking the previously blocked content. They either block all of Orchid or nothing, so if things continue to work after turning on Orchid, then your ISP has allowed “Orchid in general” and cannot manipulate the individual bytes between you and the rest of the Internet.
trans-unit.target: If you are not happy with or do not trust your existing ISP(s), by using Orchid you can currently limit their knowledge to knowing only that you are sending and receiving bytes through Orchid, and completely block their ability to mess with the details of your traffic, unblocking the previously blocked content. They either block all of Orchid or nothing, so if things continue to work after turning on Orchid, then your ISP has allowed “Orchid in general” and cannot manipulate the individual bytes between you and the rest of the Internet.

trans-unit.source:
The goal with the Orchid app is to give users insight and control over the network connection of their device. To gain privacy, users configure a circuit in Orchid by setting up an Orchid account and funding it with OXT. Then the Orchid app connects to the Orchid network and selects a node using Orchid’s
linear stake-weighted algorithm
to serve as a VPN and pays for bandwidth via a continuous stream of tiny OXT
nanopayments
.
trans-unit.target:
The goal with the Orchid app is to give users insight and control over the network connection of their device. To gain privacy, users configure a circuit in Orchid by setting up an Orchid account and funding it with OXT. Then the Orchid app connects to the Orchid network and selects a node using Orchid’s
linear stake-weighted algorithm
to serve as a VPN and pays for bandwidth via a continuous stream of tiny OXT
nanopayments
.

trans-unit.source: In a single-hop circuit configuration, Orchid provides:
trans-unit.target: In a single-hop circuit configuration, Orchid provides:

trans-unit.source: A potential problem with using only a single VPN provider is that the provider running the single node circuit knows both your IP address and the content you are accessing. If the provider maintains logs, those logs could be sold to advertisers or otherwise used against you. In the current VPN marketplace, it is hard to know who is maintaining logs and who is not. For Orchid nodes, we have developed a flexible curation system that gives users a way to pick whom to trust. Read more here.
trans-unit.target: A potential problem with using only a single VPN provider is that the provider running the single node circuit knows both your IP address and the content you are accessing. If the provider maintains logs, those logs could be sold to advertisers or otherwise used against you. In the current VPN marketplace, it is hard to know who is maintaining logs and who is not. For Orchid nodes, we have developed a flexible curation system that gives users a way to pick whom to trust. Read more here.

trans-unit.source: Another solution is to trust no single provider with enough information to know both who you are and what information you are accessing. To that end, Orchid supports an advanced feature that allows users to configure multi-hop routes of their own, by stringing together several Orchid nodes into a multi-hop circuit. Each hop may be constructed with any protocol supported by Orchid (initially just Orchid hops and OpenVPN). While the potential is there to protect the user from any one provider knowing enough information to reveal their circuit, this is an advanced feature that is currently “use at your own risk”.
trans-unit.target: Another solution is to trust no single provider with enough information to know both who you are and what information you are accessing. To that end, Orchid supports an advanced feature that allows users to configure multi-hop routes of their own, by stringing together several Orchid nodes into a multi-hop circuit. Each hop may be constructed with any protocol supported by Orchid (initially just Orchid hops and OpenVPN). While the potential is there to protect the user from any one provider knowing enough information to reveal their circuit, this is an advanced feature that is currently “use at your own risk”.

trans-unit.source:
When a user sets up an Orchid hop, the Orchid protocol requires an ERC-20 Ethereum token, OXT, to send tiny and continuous nanopayments to providers for the duration of the connection. While the
nanopayment architecture
locks user funds into a smart contract and only issues on-chain payments to providers very rarely, occasional winning tickets result in OXT payments posted on the public Ethereum blockchain. When that happens, the user’s Ethereum address, the provider’s Ethereum address, and a timestamp are stored on the Ethereum blockchain. Note that the address of the provider is not a mapping to a single server, but rather the wallet that the provider created to receive funds for running the Orchid node. Also, the frequency of how often on-chain payments occur is configurable.
trans-unit.target:
When a user sets up an Orchid hop, the Orchid protocol requires an ERC-20 Ethereum token, OXT, to send tiny and continuous nanopayments to providers for the duration of the connection. While the
nanopayment architecture
locks user funds into a smart contract and only issues on-chain payments to providers very rarely, occasional winning tickets result in OXT payments posted on the public Ethereum blockchain. When that happens, the user’s Ethereum address, the provider’s Ethereum address, and a timestamp are stored on the Ethereum blockchain. Note that the address of the provider is not a mapping to a single server, but rather the wallet that the provider created to receive funds for running the Orchid node. Also, the frequency of how often on-chain payments occur is configurable.

trans-unit.source: All information gained by a potential network attacker is an advantage. However, consider exactly what information is revealed. For an Orchid user running a single hop circuit: the provider sees the user’s payment address when it accepts service, along with the user’s real IP address and the destination addresses that the user is connecting to (if it maintains logs). Once a rare on-chain payment is made, the user’s payment address and provider’s payment address are stored on Ethereum with a timestamp available to the public.
trans-unit.target: All information gained by a potential network attacker is an advantage. However, consider exactly what information is revealed. For an Orchid user running a single hop circuit: the provider sees the user’s payment address when it accepts service, along with the user’s real IP address and the destination addresses that the user is connecting to (if it maintains logs). Once a rare on-chain payment is made, the user’s payment address and provider’s payment address are stored on Ethereum with a timestamp available to the public.

trans-unit.source: When considering anonymity, it is important to understand if the user is linked to the OXT used in their circuit. Worst case, if the user purchased OXT on an exchange with their real identity, AND the VPN provider used in the circuit maintained logs, then either of those two entities could be compelled to give information that could deanonymize the user. Similarly, a user who paid for a VPN service that maintained logs with a credit card could be deanonymized with just one entity being compelled.
trans-unit.target: When considering anonymity, it is important to understand if the user is linked to the OXT used in their circuit. Worst case, if the user purchased OXT on an exchange with their real identity, AND the VPN provider used in the circuit maintained logs, then either of those two entities could be compelled to give information that could deanonymize the user. Similarly, a user who paid for a VPN service that maintained logs with a credit card could be deanonymized with just one entity being compelled.

trans-unit.source: OXT is a “pre-mined” cryptocurrency based on the ERC-20 standard that will be used to decentralize trust between buyers and sellers in the Orchid marketplace. It also functions as a tool to promote security and healthy market dynamics, as providers can adjust their OXT stake to remain competitive. At launch we intend there to be a limited supply of one billion (1,000,000,000). We do not intend ever to create any additional OXT.
trans-unit.target: OXT is a “pre-mined” cryptocurrency based on the ERC-20 standard that will be used to decentralize trust between buyers and sellers in the Orchid marketplace. It also functions as a tool to promote security and healthy market dynamics, as providers can adjust their OXT stake to remain competitive. At launch we intend there to be a limited supply of one billion (1,000,000,000). We do not intend ever to create any additional OXT.

trans-unit.source: The Orchid client calls an on-chain ‘curated list’ function which filters the viable nodes on Orchid (that is, nodes that have properly staked) into a custom subset. Initial releases of the official Orchid client will use this feature to prevent certain kinds of attacks from malicious exit nodes (e.g. SSL downgrade attacks) by using a default list consisting of trusted VPN partners.
trans-unit.target: The Orchid client calls an on-chain ‘curated list’ function which filters the viable nodes on Orchid (that is, nodes that have properly staked) into a custom subset. Initial releases of the official Orchid client will use this feature to prevent certain kinds of attacks from malicious exit nodes (e.g. SSL downgrade attacks) by using a default list consisting of trusted VPN partners.

trans-unit.source:
We want to hear from you
Let's reclaim the Internet together! We are looking for partnership opportunities with infrastructure providers and integration partners that want to build with Orchid. Contact us and we'll get back to you shortly.
trans-unit.target:
여러분의 의견을 기다립니다.
함께 인터넷을 되찾읍시다! Orchid와 함께 일할 인프라 제공업체 및 통합업체 파트너를 찾고 있습니다. 연락 주시면 곧 연락 드리겠습니다.

trans-unit.source: There was an unknown error, your message may not have been sent
trans-unit.target: 알 수 없는 오류가 있었습니다. 메시지가 전송되지 않았을 수 있습니다.

trans-unit.source:
We can
reclaim the
internet
together

Why build a privacy network?
The Internet opened up an unlimited world of information. Its creators invited us to bring our curiosity and explore that world freely.
As the Internet grew, exploring freely became harder. Web 2.0 business models incentivized companies to watch and track us and sell our data. And in some places, limits were placed on the information we can see.
But that is changing. The decentralized Web 3.0 being built on Ethereum is allowing the Internet to be reclaimed by its users.
At Orchid we share in this mission. We use Web 3.0 technology to offer users better digital privacy today, so we can realize the promise of the Web 1.0 and explore freely again.
Orchid was founded in 2017 to help restore the open and accessible Internet for everyone. Since then, we have grown an incredible team based in San Francisco and Berlin and launched the first incentivized, peer-to-peer privacy network in December, 2019.
trans-unit.target:
인터넷은 무한한 정보의 시대를 열었습니다. 크리에이터들 덕분에 우리는 호기심을 갖고 자유롭게 세상을 탐험할 수 있었습니다.
그러나 인터넷이 성장할수록 자유로운 탐색은 더 어려워졌습니다. Web 2.0 비즈니스 모델에 따라 기업들은 우리를 관찰, 추적하고 데이터를 팔아 넘겼습니다. 어떤 곳에서는 우리가 볼 수 있는 정보에 제한이 있었습니다.
그러나 이제는 변하고 있습니다. 이더리움 기반으로 구축되는 분산형 Web 3.0은 본래 주인인 사용자에게 인터넷을 되돌려 줍니다.
Orchid 역시 이 임무에 동참합니다. Web 3.0 기술을 통해 오늘날 사용자에게 더 나은 디지털 개인 정보 보호를 보장하므로, Web 1.0의 약속을 실천하고 자유롭게 탐색할 수 있습니다.
2017년 설립된 Orchid는, 누구나 손쉽게 접근 가능한 개방적인 인터넷을 되찾기 위해 노력합니다. 설립 이후 샌프란시스코와 베를린을 기반으로 놀라운 성장을 보여준 우리 팀은 2019년 4분기 Orchid 토큰화된 VPN을 출시하게 되었습니다.

trans-unit.source: Orchid’s founders bring together deep experience in the open source software community (BASH Shell, GNU Finger), technology management (RPX IPO), blockchain investment (Pantera Capital), jailbroken app package management (Cydia) and security (Wells Fargo’s 1st Online Banking employee, Ethereum core security team).
trans-unit.target: 오픈 소스 소프트웨어 커뮤니티(BASH Shell, GNU Finger), 기술 관리(RPX IPO), 블록체인 투자(Bitstamp, Pantera Capital), 탈옥 앱 패키지 관리(Cydia), 보안(Wells Fargo의 최초 온라인 뱅킹 직원, 이더리움 핵심 보안 팀) 분야에서 깊이 있는 경험을 쌓은 전문가들이 의기투합하여 Orchid의 창립 멤버가 되었습니다.
